connector.description: Query data from a Databricks Database. For Unity Catalog workspaces, specify catalog and schema parameters.

camel.kamelet.databricks-source.serverPo.name: camel.kamelet.databricks-source.serverPort
camel.kamelet.databricks-source.serverPo.description: The server port for the Databricks data source.

camel.kamelet.databricks-source.httpPath.name: camel.kamelet.databricks-source.httpPath
camel.kamelet.databricks-source.httpPath.description: The HTTP path to the Databricks SQL Warehouse or cluster. Example: /sql/1.0/warehouses/abc123def456

camel.kamelet.databricks-source.accessTo.name: camel.kamelet.databricks-source.accessToken
camel.kamelet.databricks-source.accessTo.description: The personal access token to access Databricks.

camel.kamelet.databricks-source.query.name: camel.kamelet.databricks-source.query
camel.kamelet.databricks-source.query.description: The query to execute against the Databricks Database. Example: SELECT * FROM accounts

camel.kamelet.databricks-source.consumed.name: camel.kamelet.databricks-source.consumedQuery
camel.kamelet.databricks-source.consumed.description: A query to run on a tuple consumed. Example: DELETE FROM accounts where user_id = :#user_id

camel.kamelet.databricks-source.delay.name: camel.kamelet.databricks-source.delay
camel.kamelet.databricks-source.delay.description: The number of milliseconds before the next poll from the Databricks database.
